question: 照り焼き
sourceMnemonic: You <kanji>illuminate</kanji> and then <kanji>bake</kanji> some food. To illuminate it, you put on some shiny sauce. Then, you cook it. Sound familiar, in terms of a type of food? This is <vocabulary>teriyaki</vocabulary>, though I have to warn you it's quite different from what you get at "teriyaki shops" in the west.
sourceReadingMnemonic: The reading comes from <ja>照る</ja> and <ja>焼く</ja>. Put them together and you have something delicious.
